intro: Peucedanum alpinum, commonly known as alpine parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Peucedanum alpinum is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate foliage and early spring blooms.
